data.event: The site having previously been Wascana ("Buffalo Bones" in Cree), it was renamed in 1882 in honour of Queen Victoria, Victoria Regina, by her daughter Princess Louise, wife of the Marquess of Lorne, then the Governor General of Canada.

event.title: designated the city its capital in 1906

data.event: Regina's importance was further secured when the new province of Saskatchewan designated the city its capital in 1906.
